com.moppyandroid.main.service

Class MoppyUsbManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.moppyandroid.main.service.MoppyUsbManager

  • public class MoppyUsbManager
extends Object
    Manages the USB serial connections to Moppy devices and provides information about them.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      MoppyUsbManager(StatusBus statusBus, Context context)
      Creates a MoppyUsbManager, using the specified bus to alert consumers to device change events.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods

      Connects to a specified network bridge using its serial port path (e.g.

      Retrieves the list of the identifiers for all connected bridges

      Uses the identifier of a device to get the associated UsbDevice, which should only be used to find information about the device.

      Retrieves the associated UsbDevice instance for all devices, which should only be used to find information about the device.

      Retrieves the list of bridge identifiers that are available for connection.

    • Constructor Detail

      • MoppyUsbManager

        public MoppyUsbManager(StatusBus statusBus,
                       Context context)
        Creates a MoppyUsbManager, using the specified bus to alert consumers to device change events.
        Parameters:
        statusBus - the bus used to communicate with status consumers

    • Method Detail

      • connectBridge

        public void connectBridge(String bridgeIdentifier)
                   throws IOException
        Connects to a specified network bridge using its serial port path (e.g. /dev/bus/usb/001/002). Potentially throws BridgeSerial.UnableToObtainDeviceException.
        Parameters:
        bridgeIdentifier - the identifier of the bridge to connect
        Throws:
        IOException - if unable to create the bridge

      • closeBridge

        public void closeBridge(String bridgeIdentifier)
                 throws IOException
        Closes a specified network bridge using its serial port path (e.g. /dev/bus/usb/001/002). The IOException is informational and can be ignored without any side effects.
        Parameters:
        bridgeIdentifier - the identifier of the bridge to close
        Throws:
        IOException - if unable to send the close message to the device

      • closeAllBridges

        public void closeAllBridges()
        Closes all open connections, logging and discarding any generated IOExceptions.

      • isConnected

        public boolean isConnected(String bridgeIdentifier)
        Checks if a specific bridge is connected using its serial port path (e.g. /dev/bus/usb/001/002).
        Parameters:
        bridgeIdentifier - the identifier of the bridge to check connection status

      • refreshDeviceList

        public void refreshDeviceList()
        Refreshes the list of bridge identifiers with connected devices guaranteed to remain.

      • getPrimaryBridge

        public NetworkBridge<Object> getPrimaryBridge()
        Retrieves the MultiBridge this MoppyUsbManager manages. Needed for registering this MoppyUsbManager to receive messages from a MoppyMIDIReceiverSender.
        Returns:
        the managed MultiBridge

      • getDevices

        public List<String> getDevices()
        Retrieves the list of bridge identifiers that are available for connection. The list used by connectBridge(String) is updated automatically upon device plugging/unplugging, however the list returned here is not. This list can be updated with refreshDeviceList().
        Returns:
        the cached bridge identifiers

      • getNumberConnected

        public int getNumberConnected()
        Retrieves the number of connected bridges.
        Returns:
        the number of bridges

      • getConnectedIdentifiers

        public List<String> getConnectedIdentifiers()
        Retrieves the list of the identifiers for all connected bridges
        Returns:
        the connect bridge identifiers

      • getDeviceInfo

        public UsbDevice getDeviceInfo(String identifier)
        Uses the identifier of a device to get the associated UsbDevice, which should only be used to find information about the device. Attempting to connect to the device may hamper MoppyUsbManager operation.
        Parameters:
        identifier - the identifier of the device to find information on
        Returns:
        null if not found, otherwise the associated UsbDevice

      • getDeviceInfoForAll

        public ArrayList<UsbDevice> getDeviceInfoForAll()
        Retrieves the associated UsbDevice instance for all devices, which should only be used to find information about the device. ArrayList returned rather than List because it implements Serializable.
        Returns:
        an ArrayList<UsbDevice> containing all available devices
        See Also:
        getDeviceInfo(String)
